personalInfo.splInterest: New experiences, the beach, Liverpool FC

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2015 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.carHigh: 2014: Finished T2 as an amateur at PGA TOUR Canada's California Qualifying School to earn exempt status...Four rounds in the 60s were good for a T5 finish at The Syncrude Boreal Open...Second top-10 finish came at the Staal Foundation Open. Opened 67-65-70 and entered the final round two strokes behind leader Wes Homan. Closed with a birdie on the 72nd hole to shoot 70 and finish second, one short of Homan's 271 total...Opened 63-66-70 to hold the 54-hole lead at the inaugural Forces and Families Open. Posted a final-round 70 and finished fourth, overtaken by winner Greg Machtaler, who carded a 9-under-par 62 to edge Peter Campbell and Jeff Dennis by one stroke...Closed the season with five consecutive top-25 finishes...Moved inside The Five on the Order of Merit with a T19 finish at the Cape Breton Celtic Classic...A T10 finish at the TOUR Championship of Canada secured a No. 5 finish on the Order of Merit and conditional status on the 2015 Web.com Tour...Improved his 2015 status at Web.com Tour Q-School in December when he finished T16.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Two-time, first-team All-America at Central Florida in 2012-13 and 2013-14. Named American Athletic Conference Player of the Year in 2013-14 and Conference USA Player of the Year in 2012-13. Captured seven tournaments during collegiate career. Also honorable mention All-America as a sophomore in 2011-12 and Conference USA Freshman of the Year in 2010-11...Played on England's squad at the 2010 European Boys' Team Championship in Turkey.
tourBios.personal: Entrance song on the first tee would be "Summer of '69" by Bryan Adams...Biggest thrill outside golf is riding roller coasters...Best sporting event attended was the Masters tournament, and he would like to trade places with Great Britain Prime Minister David Cameron for a day...Lists skydiving and traveling the world at the top of bucket list. Favorite motto is "Some people dream of success; others wake up and work hard for it."...Favorite book is Your 15th Club, and his favorite athlete is Dwayne Johnson...Dream foursome includes his father, Ian Poulter and Dwayne Johnson...Twitter handle is @gregeasongolf. Closed with four final-round birdies .

tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season having played all 25 events. Had two top-10s, six top-25s while making 15 cuts. Was 57th on the combined Regular Season/Finals' money list...Finished T40 in the season-opening Panama Claro Championship, his first event as a Tour member...Opened with a pair of 70s the next week, at the Colombia Championship. Shot 67-65 on the weekend to T6...Posted 68-67-67 at the Chile Classic and was T12 after 54 holes. Made a move on the final nine, closing out the tournament with four consecutive birdies for a 65, which equalled the low final-round score and led to a T5. Rose to 16th on the money list...First Tour ace came in the third round of The Rex Hospital Open at TPC Wakefield Plantation...Over his final 15 Regular Season events, made seven cuts, with top 25s coming at the Rust-Oleum Championship (T18) in July and the News Sentinel Open (T21) in August. Was T2 after two rounds of the Rust-Oleum event...Finished the Regular Season 63rd in earnings...In the Web.com Tour Finals, finished T22, missed cut and T29 in the first three tournaments. With earnings of $14,402 was 46th on the Finals' money list and in need of a strong finish at the Web.com Tour Championship. Opened with scores of 67-67-70 at TPC Sawgrass, placing him T12 and projected at No. 24 with one round to play. An even-par 70 Sunday was not good enough. Finished $5,203 and 10 spots behind the final-card earner.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Two-time, first-team All-America at Central Florida in 2012-13 and 2013-14. Named American Athletic Conference Player of the Year in 2013-14 and Conference USA Player of the Year in 2012-13. Captured seven tournaments during collegiate career. Also honorable mention All-America as a sophomore in 2011-12 and Conference USA Freshman of the Year in 2010-11...Played on England's squad at the 2010 European Boys' Team Championship in Turkey.
tourBios.personal: Enjoys going to the beach...Favorite book is Your 15th Club...Favorite band is The Killers...London and Los Angeles are favorite cities to visit...Favorite quote is "Follow the yellow brick road." ...Favorite golf course he has played is Valerrama, host of the 1997 Ryder Cup...Not many people know he is a a great cook.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T23rd at the Club Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T29th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
